title: The life and correspondence of Andrew Combe ...
author: Combe, George
snippet: Much attention is also given to English literature and composition ; and history and geography are taught as much as possible incidentally to what is read. In the High School and Edinburgh Academy, the amount of other knowledge imparted during and along with classical education is now much greater than it used to be, and with decidedly beneficial results to the general mind.

title: Corporal Cameron of the North West mounted police;
author: Connor, Ralph
snippet: "I am afraid my training has been defective. I have passed through Edinburgh Academy, also the University, with the exception of my last year. But I am willing to take anything."
